body.p: Once a project is open, an additional stripe is displayed below the top stripe with an Open Workspace button that creates a workspace branch starting from the latest version on the "main" branch. If a workspace is already creating, invoking the button opens the already existing workspace.

When a workspace is open, the left stripe contains the following navigation options:
Files - Displays the file tree of the workspace. You can expand or collapse folders similar to any common file browser. Click on a file to open it in the visual editor. To add a folder to the workspace, click the 3 vertical dots next to the parent folder. To delete a file from the workspace, click the 3 vertical dots next to the particular file and select Delete file.
Publications - Displays the map of a publication in a tree editor. Use the drop-down control in the side-pane to select a defined publication. You can click the Open in editor button to open the DITA map defined in the particular publication in a tree editor that is displayed in the main visual editing area. You can click on a file displayed in the side-pane to open it in the visual editor (or double-click a file when the map is open in the tree editor).
Changes - Displays all the files that have been changed in the workspace. You can click on a file to see a comparison (diff) of the changes. The version on the left shows the current workspace version while the version on the right shows the current project version. To open a file in the visual editor, click the 3 vertical dots next to the particular file and select Open file. To discard any changes you have made on a file in the workspace, click the 3 vertical dots next to the particular file and select Discard changes.
